result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tana Jo Beck-House

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Satorius. arc

*** AMENDED***

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T. Sawatzky.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T.M.G and follow the terms of protective order.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

- Defendant must reside at the Hope Gospel Mission- Eau Claire. 

- Comply with the terms and conditions of the DJOC.

3:13 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Travis Satorius  with Intern Dippolito in court for Tana Jo Beck-House. Defendant Tana Jo Beck-House in court. Intern Dippolito recites resolution. Recess 03:16 PM. Back on Record 03:18 PM. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine w/ PTAC- 961.41(3g)(g) and enters into a 18 month DJOC. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty and defers entry of conviction for 18 months. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses count 2 and 3. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

Count 1: 18 month DJOC. 

3 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 03:30 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:54 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius with Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito, DF: Tana Jo Beck-House appeared via zoom. Court reviews case. Atty Becker states all discovery has been provided. Inter Dippolito states no motions at this time. Intern Dippolito states there is an offer out but needs additional time. Court sets PLEAS. Court confirms address. Adjourned 11:59 AM  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Filed by ADA Becker. km
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Information to mirror the criminal complaint.  DF wishes to proceed with the Arraignment today.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Court confirms address.  Bond continues.

03:18 PM   Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Intern Kaitlin Dippolito w/ Travis Satorius   DF:  Tana Jo Beck-House appeared.  Atty Dippolito states DF wishes to waive the preliminary hearing.    Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty Travis Satorius. mw

01:04 PM   CO: Vlack, Reporter: V.Kasten, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius with Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito for today, DF: Tana Jo Beck-House appeared. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; sidebar; bond ordered. Waive prelim time limits. Court sets STC.
